reviewText: it was perfect great thank you

The story of the lovable absent minded hunter was never better told than in this Shirley Temple version. The acting and the historical perspective make for a very enjoyable children's story which will surely spark questions about pirates, King George III and the American Revolution. There is a sweet cadence to the delivery which is endearing and patently missing from children's programming in our very enlightened 21st Century. Watch this for the lessons it teaches about being a good father and a good husband.
